metadata.title: CVE-2016-5287 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A potentially exploitable use-after-free crash during actor destructionwith service workers. This issue does not affect releases earlier thanFirefox 49. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 49.0.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5287` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
